content: cuff joining in the round place bor marker and begin honeycomb and rib pattern as follows round 1 *k2 p rt lt p k1 2 3 p k1 2 3 p rt lt p k1 2 3 p k1 2 3 p rt lt p k2 p repeat from * to end round 2 *k2 p k4 p k1 2 3 p k1 2 3 p k4 p k1 2 3 p k1 2 3 p k4 p k2 p repeat from * to end round 3 *k2 p lt rt p k1 2 3 p k1 2 3 p lt rt p k1 2 3 p k1 2 3 p lt rt p k2 p repeat from * to end round 4 *k2 p k4 p k1 2 3 p k1 2 3 p k4 p k1 2 3 p k1 2 3 p k4 p k2 p repeat from * to end repeat these 4 rounds twice more 3 times in all or 12 rounds in all alternate cuff round 1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round repeat this round 11 more times for a total of 12 rounds �4 leg * notice that from this point the pattern will be worked on the front of the leg and the instep only and the back of the leg will be in plain stockinette * note that the slip_stitch for the panel must hang on the outside to show the honeycomb motif so the yarn will be held in front when you slip those stitches round 1 k2 p rt lt p pm k12 16 20 pm p rt lt p k to end round 2 k2 p k4 p sm *sl wyf 1 p1 repeat from * to marker sm p k4 p k to end round 3 k2 p lt rt p sm k12 16 20 sm p lt rt p k to end round 4 k2 p k4 p sm *p1 sl wyf 1 repeat from * to marker sm p k4 p k to end repeat these 4 rounds 14 more times 15 times in total or until desired length of leg is achieved *note on the very last round of the leg do not knit the very last stitch but rather pass it to the front leg it will become the first stitch of the instep once we reach the gusset if you have forgotten this step simply unknit the last stitch and pass it to the front needle *we will want to knit the heel flap on 28 32 36 stitches if you now look at your back needle you should have 29 33 37 stitches on the first row of the heel flap there will be a note to finish the redistribution of the stitches �5 heel flap honeycomb * note that the slip_stitch for the flap must hang on the outside to show the honeycomb motif so the yarn will be held in back when you slip those
